intro: Daviesia striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed peacock wattles, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and red flowers. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and narrow, serrated leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Daviesia striata is often found in coastal and heathland habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
